item.title: 美国页岩气钻井数量创五年来最长连降纪录
item.description: 由于页岩勘探者摆脱了近期原油价格跳涨的影响，美国原油钻井平台数量出现了约五年来最长的单周连续下降。【原文：The number of rigs drilling for crude in the US declined for the longest weekly streak in about five years as shale explorers shrugged off a recent jump in crude prices.】

item.title: 银行希望重振出售 24 亿美元帕特森收购债务的雄风
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在被迫为帕特森公司（Patterson Cos.）的债务提供资金两个多月后，银行正在寻求恢复为 Patient Square Capital 收购帕特森公司提供 23.5 亿美元融资的销售。【原文：Banks are looking to revive a sale for a $2.35 billion financing for Patient Square Capital’s acquisition of Patterson Cos., a little over two months after they were forced to fund the debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 道明称美元的下一个风险是加拿大养老基金套期保值
item.description: 据道明证券（TD Securities）称，随着加拿大投资者（美股最大持有者之一）面临提高对美元货币对冲的压力，美元有望进一步下跌。【原文：The US dollar is poised to tumble further as Canadian investors — among the largest holders of American stocks — face pressure to raise their currency hedges against the greenback, according to TD Securities.】

item.description:

item.title: AST SpaceMobile 在罗素 1000 指数纳入之前创下历史新高
item.description: AST SpaceMobile 公司本月的涨幅达到三位数，但没有停止的迹象，该公司准备在周五收盘后加入罗素 1000 指数，这可能会释放被动投资者的新需求。【原文：A triple-digit rally in AST SpaceMobile Inc. this month shows no signs of stopping as it prepares to join the Russell 1000 Index after Friday’s market close, potentially unlocking new demand from passive investors.】

item.title: 第一量子公司开始从巴拿马矿场运输库存铜矿
item.description: 第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd.）已开始从其停滞不前的巴拿马矿场运输库存铜矿，这是在巴拿马最高法院关闭该矿场 19 个月之后。【原文：First Quantum Minerals Ltd. has started shipping stockpiled copper from its stalled mine in Panama, 19 months after the operation was shut down by the country’s top court.】

item.title: Fortress 20 亿美元地产债券可能错过兑付日期
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，一家与堡垒投资集团（Fortress Investment Group）有关联的企业实体向投资者发出警告称，该公司很可能会错过为约 20 亿美元的债券再融资的关键截止日期，这些债券是由出租给亚马逊公司的仓库所支持的。【原文：A corporate entity tied to Fortress Investment Group warned investors that it will likely miss a key deadline to refinance about $2 billion of bonds backed by warehouses leased to Amazon.com, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 海洋公园前首席执行官因与贷款人争执每天被罚 1 万美元
item.description: 一连串破产的海豚主题动物乐园的前首席执行官正面临着每天 1 万美元的罚款，因为他被指控使用他在好市多购买的信用卡读卡器，将门票收入从其公司的墨西哥分店转移出去。【原文：The former chief executive officer of a string of bankrupt, dolphin-themed animal parks is facing a $10,000-a-day fine, after he was accused of using credit-card readers he bought at Costco to divert ticket revenue away from his company’s Mexican locations.】

item.title: 债权人相互倾轧，萨克斯获得 6 亿美元救命钱
item.description: 萨克斯全球企业与一些现有投资者达成了一项 6 亿美元的债务协议，该协议将迫使一些债权人接受损失，并将他们推后到还款优先顺序。【原文：Saks Global Enterprises has reached a $600 million debt deal with a number of its existing investors that would force some creditors to accept losses and push them back in the repayment priority line.】

item.title: 投资德黑兰就像投资 2010 年的比特币
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 工会授权得克萨斯州泰森食品公司牛肉工厂罢工
item.description: 泰森食品公司位于得克萨斯州阿马里洛的牛肉工厂的工人们同意举行罢工，以争取更高的工资，并指责该公司存在不公平的劳工行为。【原文：Workers at Tyson Foods Inc.’s beef plant in Amarillo, Texas, have agreed to a strike as they fight for higher wages and accuse the company of unfair labor practices.】

item.title: 花旗财富首席信息官担心交易员忽视 S&P 反弹中的 "警示信号
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税最后期限迫在眉睫、中东战争和经济不确定性上升等风险层出不穷，但美国股市仍在历史高位运行，一些大牌基金经理对市场的现状越来越担忧。【原文：With US stocks trading at all-time highs despite a wealth of risks from President Donald Trump’s looming tariff deadline, war in the Middle East and rising economic uncertainty, some big-time money managers are growing concerned about where the market stands.】

item.title: 尽管七国集团达成了协议，但加拿大的数字服务税依然存在
item.description: 尽管七国集团达成协议，取消了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普税收法案中的第 899 款 "报复税 "提案，但加拿大仍在继续对 Meta Platforms 公司等科技公司征收数字服务税。【原文：Canada is proceeding with its digital services tax on technology companies such as Meta Platforms Inc. despite a Group of Seven agreement that resulted in removing the Section 899 “revenge tax” proposal from US President Donald Trump’s tax bill.】

item.title: 稀土为何是中国与美国贸易战中的 "特朗普牌"？
item.description: 稀土是地球上最重要的原材料之一，深深嵌入了支撑现代生活的技术之中。然而，在中美贸易战爆发之前，很少有人听说过稀土。【原文：Rare earths are among the most critical raw materials on the planet, deeply embedded in the technologies that underpin modern life. Yet few people had even heard of them until the eruption of the US-China trade war thrust them into the limelight.】

item.title: 联邦存款保险公司支持影响国债的关键银行资本规则计划
item.description: 联邦存款保险公司（Federal Deposit Insurance Corp）推进了监管机构放宽一项关键资本规则的计划，大银行称这项规则限制了它们在 29 万亿美元国债市场上充当中介的能力。【原文：The Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. advanced regulators’ plan to ease a key capital rule that big banks have said limits their ability to act as intermediaries in the $29 trillion Treasuries market.】

item.title: 加州民主党人推动改革以防止炼油厂停工
item.description: 加利福尼亚州的一群民主党人正在寻求放宽该州的汽油标准，简化炼油厂的许可程序，以防止更多的燃料制造商停产，从而提高该州司机的成本。【原文：A group of California Democrats is looking to ease the state’s gasoline standards and streamline permitting for refineries in a bid to prevent more fuelmakers from shutting down and raising costs for the state’s drivers.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"将考虑再次超大规模提高石油产量
item.description: 欧佩克+"将在下个月的会议上考虑延长其超大规模的增产计划，因为该集团领导人沙特阿拉伯正带头努力夺回市场份额。【原文：OPEC+ is set to consider extending its run of super-sized production increases at a meeting next month, as group leader Saudi Arabia leads a push to recoup market share.】

item.title: 赞比亚采取措施避免被列入美国旅行禁令名单
item.description: 赞比亚表示，它在解决美国政府提出的若干关切方面取得了进展，因为它正努力避免被列入扩大的旅行禁令名单。【原文：Zambia says it has made progress in addressing several concerns raised by the US government, as it seeks to avoid being placed on an expanded travel ban list.】

item.title: 卢拉将向最高法院起诉推翻税收法令的行为
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的政府官员透露，路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统的政府将向巴西最高法院提出上诉，试图维护国会本周推翻的一项税收法令。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s administration will appeal to Brazil’s Supreme Court to try to preserve a tax decree that Congress overturned this week, according to two government officials familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国最高法院维持色情网站年龄验证法
item.description: 美国最高法院维持了德克萨斯州一项要求色情网站核实用户年龄的法律，驳回了该法律要求成人在线提交身份证明从而侵犯了成人言论自由权的论点。【原文：The US Supreme Court upheld a Texas law that requires porn sites to verify user age, rejecting arguments that the measure violates the speech rights of adults by requiring them to submit identification online.】

item.title: 美国监管机构称将于 8 月 26 日就主要银行资本规则提交评论意见
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会和其他银行监管机构将8月26日设定为就放宽一项关键银行资本规则的提案征求公众意见的最后期限，并表示他们预计大贷款机构因其计划而将维持的总体资本额将 "基本保持不变"。【原文：The US Federal Reserve and other bank regulators set an Aug. 26 deadline for public comments on a proposal to ease a key bank capital rule, saying they expect the amount of overall capital that big lenders would maintain as a result of their plan would “generally stay the same.”】

item.title: 阿根廷金融科技公司 tapi 收购万事达卡在墨西哥的分支机构
item.description: 阿根廷支付服务初创公司 tapi 收购了万事达卡旗下 Arcus 公司在墨西哥的账单支付和现金处理业务，这是该公司在拉美第二大经济体加倍努力的一部分。【原文：Argentine payments services startup tapi has acquired the bill payment and cash-handling operations of Mastercard’s Arcus in Mexico, part of a bid to double-down on Latin America’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 关税威胁缓解，经济学家上调加拿大经济增长预期
item.description: 由于对与美国贸易争端旷日持久的担忧逐渐减弱，分析师们提高了对加拿大今年经济增长的预测。【原文：Analysts boosted their forecasts for economic growth in Canada this year as fears of a drawn-out trade dispute with the US fade.】

item.title: 最高法院支持联邦通信委员会 86 亿美元的电信补贴基金
item.description: 美国最高法院维持了 86 亿美元的通用服务基金（Universal Service Fund），该基金每年提供一系列补贴，帮助支付低收入人群、农村居民、学校和图书馆的电信服务费用。【原文：The US Supreme Court upheld the $8.6 billion Universal Service Fund, the annual slate of subsidies that helps cover the cost of telecom services for low-income people, rural residents, schools and libraries.】

item.title: 艾德勒考虑出售价值 35 亿欧元的柏林租赁资产组合
item.description: 阿德勒集团（Adler Group SA）正在考虑出售其珍贵的柏林公寓投资组合，这笔交易将标志着这家丑闻缠身的德国房东在缓慢解体过程中迈出了具有里程碑意义的一步。【原文：Adler Group SA is weighing the sale of its prized portfolio of Berlin apartments, a deal that would mark a landmark step in the slow unraveling of the scandal-hit German landlord.】

item.title: 雷德伯恩认为波音公司 "更健康"，获得买入评级
item.description: 据 Rothschild & Co.雷德伯恩【原文：Shares of Boeing Co. are set to make gains as the company speeds up production of commercial aircraft and takes steps to move on from a series of crises in recent years, according to Rothschild & Co. Redburn.】

item.title: 津巴布韦漂浮式太阳能项目寻求 3.5 亿美元融资
item.description: 津巴布韦的主要电力用户正在为雄心勃勃的浮动太阳能发电厂寻求高达 3.5 亿美元的资金，并已从非洲进出口银行获得 440 万美元用于可行性研究。【原文：Zimbabwe’s major power users are seeking as much as $350 million for an ambitious floating solar plant and have secured $4.4 million from the African Export-Import Bank for a feasibility study.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚计划提高财产税和股息税以遏制预算缺口
item.description: 罗马尼亚总理概述了削减不断膨胀的预算赤字的新措施，新政府正努力维护该国的投资级评级并缓解投资者的担忧。【原文：Romania’s premier outlined fresh measures to cut the ballooning budget deficit as the new government seeks to safeguard the country’s investment-grade rating and ease investor concern.】

item.title: 麦格理控股的光纤供应商在资金紧张的情况下寻找债务顾问
item.description: 由于麦格理（Macquarie）旗下的 KCOM 公司现金消耗殆尽，英国宽带供应商 KCOM 集团有限公司及其贷款人正准备进行债务谈判。【原文：UK broadband provider KCOM Group Limited and its lenders are gearing up for debt talks as the business owned by Macquarie burns through cash.】
